conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Point A is connected to a purple baffle.
The purple baffle is positioned above the green container (E).
The liquid will flow downward from A and directly into container E.
Point B is connected to a yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle is positioned above the orange container (D).
The liquid will flow downward from B and directly into container D.
Point C is connected to a blue baffle.
The blue baffle is positioned above the green container (E).
The liquid will flow downward from C and directly into container E.
The liquid from points A and C will flow into container E.
The liquid from point B will flow into container D.
The liquid will flow into both containers D and E, with A and C flowing into E, and B flowing into D.
